com.github.mucaho.jnetemu

Class DatagramWanEmulator

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.mucaho.jnetemu.DatagramWanEmulator
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    SimpleWanEmulator

    public abstract class DatagramWanEmulator
extends Object
    A convenience class for debugging UDP communication. The DatagramWanEmulator sits between two specified DatagramSockets and emulates various network conditions.

    In order to use the emulator, you send the DatagramPackets directly to the emulator's SocketAddress instead of sending them to the receiver SocketAddress. The emulator will then apply various network conditions, before sending those packets to the receiver SocketAddress.

    This class can be partially instantiated using the respective constructor. Use the appropriate methods to start and stop the emulation. The actual computation of network conditions is given by subclasses of this abstract class.

    Internally, this emulator uses a single thread for all emulator instances by leveraging NIO selectors & non-blocking channels.

    There are multiple emulator configuration options available, some possibilities are illustrated in the following figures:
    Emulator sitting on PeerA, emulating network conditions for outgoing traffic only. 

     ╔══════════╗      ╔═════╗      ╔═════════╗
 ║ A -> EMU ║ ---> ║     ║ ---> ║    A    ║
 ║ P        ║      ║ ??? ║      ║    P    ║
 ║ P  <--   ║ <--- ║     ║ <--- ║    P    ║
 ╚══════════╝      ╚═════╝      ╚═════════╝
    PeerA          Network         PeerB

    Emulator sitting on PeerA, emulating network conditions for both outgoing and incoming traffic. 
     ╔═════════╗      ╔═════╗      ╔═════════╗
 ║ A     E ║      ║     ║      ║    A    ║
 ║ P <-> M ║ <--> ║ ??? ║ <--> ║    P    ║
 ║ P     U ║      ║     ║      ║    P    ║
 ╚═════════╝      ╚═════╝      ╚═════════╝
    PeerA         Network         PeerB

    One emulator sitting on each peer, emulating network conditions for its outgoing traffic respectively. 
     ╔══════════╗      ╔═════╗      ╔══════════╗
 ║ A -> EMU ║ ---> ║     ║ ---> ║    --> A ║
 ║ P        ║      ║ ??? ║      ║        P ║
 ║ P <--    ║ <--- ║     ║ <--- ║ EMU <- P ║
 ╚══════════╝      ╚═════╝      ╚══════════╝
    PeerA          Network         PeerB

    • Field Detail

      • MINIMUM__PACKET_SIZE

        public static final int MINIMUM__PACKET_SIZE
        Minimum payload size in bytes of an UDP datagram that will not cause fragmentation in the IP layer.

        That's the minimum supported MTU for IPv4 (576 B), minus the maximum IPv4 header size (60 B) and minus the UDP header size (8 B). Defaults to 508 B.

        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DEFAULT_PACKET_SIZE

        public static final int DEFAULT_PACKET_SIZE
        Size in bytes of the usually supported MTU for IPv4. Defaults to 1500 B.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • DatagramWanEmulator

        public DatagramWanEmulator(SocketAddress emulatorAddress,
                           SocketAddress socketAddressA,
                           SocketAddress socketAddressB)
        Construct a new DatagramWanEmulator. This will automatically create a new socket bound to the specified emulatorAddress, with maxPacketSize set to MINIMUM__PACKET_SIZE.
        Parameters:
        emulatorAddress - the emulator address
        socketAddressA - one socket address
        socketAddressB - the other socket address

                           SocketAddress socketAddressB,
                           int maxPacketSize)
        Construct a new DatagramWanEmulator. This will automatically create a new socket bound to the specified emulatorAddress.
        Parameters:
        emulatorAddress - the emulator address
        socketAddressA - one socket address
        socketAddressB - the other socket address
        maxPacketSize - the maximum size of incoming / outgoing datagram packets (in bytes).

    • Method Detail

      • computeNetworkConditions

        protected abstract void computeNetworkConditions(long timeNow,
                                                 Collection<? extends DatagramWanEmulator.Scheduled> scheduled,
                                                 List<Long> scheduledTimes)
        Compute network conditions. Actual implementation given in subclasses.
        This method will be called once per incoming packet and computes the network conditions for the outgoing packet. At any time it is guaranteed to be called from a single thread only, thus implementing classes should not worry about threading issues.
        Parameters:
        timeNow - the current low-resolution system time in ms, that should be used by all time-dependent computations. It represents the difference between the current time and midnight, 01.01.1970 UTC.
        scheduled - a read-only ordered collection containing already scheduled packets. Note that packets being duplicated are represented multiple times in this collection. This is provided as additional information for computing network conditions.
        scheduledTimes - a writable list that should be filled with zero or more scheduled times at which the incoming packet will be relayed. Scheduled times are given as the difference between current time (timeNow) and midnight, 01.01.1970 UTC.
        • A zero-length list indicates packet gets dropped.
        • A list with a single element indicates at which time to relay the incoming packet.
        • A list with n elements indicates that the packet will be duplicated n-1 times. These duplicates will be sent according to the time values provided.

      • startEmulation

        public void startEmulation()
                    throws IOException
        Start the emulation between the two sockets.
        Throws:
        ClosedChannelException - if the current instance has already been stopped by stopEmulation(). Create a new instance instead.
        IOException - if there was some other I/O error

      • stopEmulation

        public void stopEmulation()
                   throws InterruptedException,
                          IOException
        Stop the emulation between the two sockets and close the associated emulator socket.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException - if the current instance is interrupted while shutting down last emulation
        IOException - if there was some other I/O error
